column4: Hi, I want to install the most current version of gmpc, what's the best way to do that ?
Find the site and download it? ;-)
it has a couple packages I'd need to update as well, plus, I'd rather install it from a repository.
By the looks of thing there isn't a repo. You can checkinstall it tho.
Instead of ./configure && make && sudo make install             you do        ./configure && make && sudo checkinstall
It creates a .deb package and installs it, so it can be managed as if it came from a repo, and easily remove/upgraded
so can I do that with all the libraries that gmpc 0.15 requires ?
You might want to check out sonata, gmpc is pretty awful.
I need profiles, I have a few mpd servers running here, and want this ubuntu machine to be able to use them all
but I can do that with libraries too, right ?
Again, I think you only need libmpd.
